title: Handguards - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning

Check the brakes operate efficiently during operation.
It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes.
Failure to take remedial action will reduce braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Move the handlebars to left and right full lock while checking that the handguards do not restrict full lock operation.
Check cables or harnesses do not bind or restrict full lock operation.
Any component, cables or harnesses that will restrict the steering may cause loss of control of the motorcycle and an accident.
Throttle Control - Check for Correct Operation of the Twist Grip
Check the throttle opens and closes smoothly during operation.
Make sure the bar end mirrors or handguards (if fitted) do not interfere with the smooth operation of the twist grip.
A twist grip that does not close fully, operate smoothly or stick in any position will result in a dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Heated grips (if fitted) will expand during operation.
When hot, the clearance between the heated twist grip and the bar end mirror or handguard will decrease.
Always test the heated grips when switched off (cold) and on (hot) to make sure the throttle opens and closes smoothly during operation.
A heated twist grip that does not close fully, operate smoothly or stick during operation will result in a dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Check for correct operation of the twist grip. Rectify if necessary.
